note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: Initial cloud based distributed expression process
body:
### Welcome to Pinko
Pinko is a distributed expression engine targetting Azure Cloud.  The project is written in C# and F# (expression engine). 
The overall architecture is open source.  The F# expression engine is not open source.  The open source project contains a mock expression engine for sample purposes only. 

Pinko is in early stages of development (Aug 2012) and not ccompleted at this point.  You can set up a watch on our project to keep track of our progress.  

### RoadMap
The goal is to create a processing engine that processes user provided formulas in realtime across multiple Azure worker roles. 

Pinko delivers real-time datafeed via [SignalR](https://github.com/SignalR/SignalR). Initial version will include some sample formulas, but as the project grows it will include a full featured HTML5/AJAX front end with Telerik Kendo controls. 

Realtime feeds are feed via Azure CDN, and other cloud base components for optimal scalabilty and availability. 


### Sample Expression
Think of Pinko as an Excel formula processor available in the cloud. A couple of sample expressions follow:  

_=RForm("Symbol", "IBM", "Price.Bid", "Reuters") * 2_

Pinko monitors the IBM price bid. Every time a new Price.Bid arrives, the formula is recalculated and streamed into the client. 

_=RHist("Symbol", "IBM", "Price.Bid", "Reuters", "Min", 360) - RHist("Symbol", "IBM", "Price.Ask", "Reuters", "Min", 360)_

RHist() retrieves 360 minutes calculates the Bid/Ask spread. Every time a new tick arrives, the formula is recalculated.

### The Cool Stuff
So we have just another expression engine, but imagine creating a historical charts on demand with your own formulas, not pre-canned averages or spreads like other systems.  

Pinko allows users to create formulas for trade ideas, color grids, ladders, historical charts, and any other analysis graphics.


### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
name: Pinko
